website_summaries.verdict: Travels light and is ideal for hikers and campers in need of filtered water in emergency and non-emergency situations
pros: Holds up to 10 liters of water
Customers cite its ease of use in extreme environments, even hurricanes
Collapsible and foldable, making it easy to bring on trips
cons: Great for emergency water filtration, but won't store food

customer_reviews.title: Quick Delivery
customer_reviews.text: Thanks for getting these to us so quickly before Hurricane Irma. I will use these for our RV now. Very pleased w this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Good design, plastic flavor
customer_reviews.text: I like the capacity of this & the idea is very different. I initially purchased it because it seems more practical than carrying around a gallon container. I can't get the plastic taste to dissipate. It's a bummer, really.
customer_reviews.author: JenaFay

customer_reviews.title: Folded nicely and clipped to the outside of my pack
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a section hike of the Appalachian trail. My friend and I each brought our dog so we needed a lot of water. She would set up camp with the dogs while I would gather all the water we needed from the nearby water source with the bag. At camp, I set it up on a log or rock, put the filtration bag under opening, and pushed down slightly allowing the bag to bend to let the water flow out. Folded nicely and clipped to the outside of my pack. Worked great and was super helpful transporting water to campsite!
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Great reusable water jugs
customer_reviews.text: Helped me to prepare for a hurricane in Florida. Was able to freeze water and keep everything from spoiling plus have drinkable water! Folds for easy storage
customer_reviews.author: MJN

customer_reviews.title: I bought two 5 liters for a fun time in the ever so wonderful 29 Palms desert ...
customer_reviews.text: These things LAST! Way worth the price and more! I bought two 5 liters for a fun time in the ever so wonderful 29 Palms desert area in July. These were put in my ruck and packed very nicely which made for a very balanced load. Easy to pour into any container or just drink from the bag itself. When its empty, it packs flat and out of the way. Thick walls to survive a good bit of abuse too.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley

customer_reviews.title: good quality, stands up on it's own
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. It will set upright on it's own, unlike some others I've used. I pack with llamas. On reaching a camp site, I rig a gravity filter and get it running into these bags. By the time the llamas are tethered and the tent set up. I have a couple gal. of clean water ready to use.
customer_reviews.author: Dick F.

customer_reviews.title: ... is limited access to water and this worked out great! Even after several drops on the dusty gravel ...
customer_reviews.text: Took this on an overnight backpacking trip where there is limited access to water and this worked out great! Even after several drops on the dusty gravel floor it held up. It made it there and back in one piece.
customer_reviews.author: dclasscldy42

customer_reviews.title: ... water carrier for gardening purposes and it is just fine. Seams are welded shut
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a water carrier for gardening purposes and it is just fine. Seams are welded shut, no signs of leakage so far. Screw on cap and mouth opening fits well and tight. Folds down completely flat. My only complaint is the handle. It's very thin and can be a little hard on the hands when carrying.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect to carry drinking water to my campsite after we backpacked in.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Good emergency water vessel.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in preparation for Hurricane Irma, these worked very well. The only drawback - and why it is only 4 stars - is that there is no way to properly dry it out when it is emptied and were concerned about growing mold. We left the caps off to allow evaporation, but that took several days.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Customer

customer_reviews.title: Space efficient but awkward and can leak
customer_reviews.text: I got about 12 of these to start stocking up on drinking water. They seem to do well, but two of them had some kinda leak and we found them empty after two months. RINSE THEM OUT before use! They stink like chemicals out of the box. Recommend buying something else.
customer_reviews.author: Max Wentler

customer_reviews.title: Water During Irma!
customer_reviews.text: This helped us out a lot with hurricane Irma! It doesn't leak and is easy to fill and pour. My only complaint is that it's hard to clean and dry. We ended up just rinsing it out and propping it upside down and it eventually dried but otherwise it was good.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: ... on a 4 day backpacking trip and it worked great. I think it holds close to 12 liters ...
customer_reviews.text: We used this on a 4 day backpacking trip and it worked great. I think it holds close to 12 liters and seems durable enough, time will tell. It is light and takes up nearly no room so is easy to take along and use at a base camp for holding water for when it is needed.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S.

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't fill and abuse like i normally would
customer_reviews.text: came broken where it was folded. They really should not fold these types of products. I couldn't fill and abuse like i normally would, but i would say it looks made and probably would've worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Alexa

customer_reviews.title: Performed as expected
customer_reviews.text: Brought it backpacking and it did the job. Made it much easier to store larger amounts of water for cooking, but lightweight while we were on the move.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney

customer_reviews.title: Would have been great, but came with holes.
customer_reviews.text: This item would have been a great item however I bought 3 or I can't remember if it came in a pack of 3 but each one had a hole in it. I had to fix it with some tape and some superglue. Which afterwards it worked perfectly. Just sucks that it came defected
customer_reviews.author: tfstills

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, convenient size for storage when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: anniegiturgun

customer_reviews.title: This product is a very poor product. I bought 3 of these to contain ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is a very poor product. I bought 3 of these to contain water in. The first one I filled up and set upright in a rental car on a seat. The bag leaked out the seam all over the seat. Luckily it was hot enough to dry out over a few days. The second bag I filled up outside and the bag again leaked out the seam. Finally I threw all three in the garbage rather than mess it anymore. I would not take these even if they were free, big waste of money. I now simply use empty 2 Liter bottles to contain water. The bottles work way better.
customer_reviews.author: chris mcdonald

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this water container to use as an condensate ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this water container to use as an condensate overflow receptacle for a portable room air conditioner. It is durable and fit my need perfectly. Although I am not using it for it's original purpose, I'm sure given its strength and construction it is ideally suited for any water transport use.
customer_reviews.author: rxkibler

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY UNLESS YOU'RE CERTAIN YOU WANT - CRAPPY RETURN POLICY!!!
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this unless you are absolutely sure you want them (and they're not that good quality). Received them, realized not the quality we needed, and the company wanted me to pay as much as I bought them for to ship them back. BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: I like the idea of it but it has a plastic ...
customer_reviews.text: Going to start with 3 stars. I like the idea of it but it has a plastic chemical smell to it. Wary of how plastic leaches into our water. I read on here to rinse with baking soda...so will try that. I just may use for emergencies instead of storing water in it for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: sandy

customer_reviews.title: Great as long as it doesn’t fall over
customer_reviews.text: Great as long as it doesn’t fall over. I had two and they both tore when they tipped over, making them useless.
customer_reviews.author: skb

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Holds plenty of water to be sure. I found the angle of the opening to be odd for the handle location. Have purchased two of these and used them on a recent trip .
customer_reviews.author: Vivian Hensley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Unused as of yet, bought for emergency or camping, haven't needed it, but sure it will work fine
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient and useful, but easily punctured when full
customer_reviews.text: Very convenient and useful, but easily punctured when full. Take a roll of duct tape with you and you can mend it quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: plastic is very brittle and cracked on first use, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Xuanhong C.

customer_reviews.title: Great price, large capacity.
customer_reviews.text: Have not used it yet. I'll assume no leaks or problems. Item is folded so hopefully it won't form a weak spot.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ross
